categories.title: AI Projects and Crypto Updates from @dankvr and @shawmakesmagic

content.text: Clank Tank Episode 4 has been released, featuring AI judges evaluating startup pitches in ~5 minute segments. The show has evolved with custom avatars for each pitcher using a ChatGPT → 3D pipeline, with only manual rigging through Mixamo (which may be streamlined by projects like Unirig). The creator is excited about adapting the format for judging hackathons or reviewing grants, similar to the deepgov experiment from gg23.

Future plans for Clank Tank include governance features where $ai16z token holders can participate by voting and deliberating with AIs after each show ends on a cliffhanger. The deliberation room sequences have potential as a governance tool, similar to news talk shows, with a new show called 'The Council' focusing more on this aspect. There's also a proposal to collaborate with the Optimism Collective.

@shawmakesmagic has been working on autodotfun, an open-source platform that appears to be a launchpad for AI agents. He's advocating for 'launchpad everything' rather than 'coining everything', suggesting a launchpad for every meme. He's currently finishing v2 of his project this week before starting v3.

There was a major issue with the Quill project launch where liquidity was burned up. @shawmakesmagic and team resolved this by adding 30k of liquidity in SOL↔Quill and ai16z↔Quill pairs (90m Quill tokens), buying and sending the dev 10m tokens, and burning the remaining 3m. He mentions spending thousands of dollars to fix the situation.

@shawmakesmagic highlights features by @xrpublisher including media in token-gated chats and integration with @yourfriendpixel. He's also working on a script to extract data and has been addressing community concerns about tokens and liquidity.

# Recent ElizaOS Pull Requests

This summary covers recent pull requests to the ElizaOS repository, including bug fixes, features, and other updates.

## Features

- Added typing indicator functionality to the Discord plugin (PR #4364)
- Added default project text to the create CLI command (PR #4369)
- Added API key validation for Anthropic Plugin model calls (PR #4383)
- Updated the ElizaOS create command instructions in the CLI (PR #4381)

## Bug Fixes

- Fixed ESM type declarations in Core (PR #4341)
- Resolved an issue with PostgreSQL database for Docker containers and updated GitHub action (PR #4363)
- Fixed broken image paths in multiple PRs (#4362, #4372)
- Corrected a broken Pump.fun link (PR #4367)
- Fixed escape for Docker compose PostgreSQL healthcheck (PR #4382)
- Updated a broken link to eliza-in-tee documentation (PR #4377)
- Added type checking for crypto values in core (PR #4376)
- Stopped throwing errors when missing service in the Discord plugin (PR #4375)
- Fixed issues with short replies (PR #4374)
- Resolved "Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'sendStandartTweet')" error (PR #4373)

## Other Updates

- Updated memory.ts to use the new schema (PR #4292)
- Added test coverage and setup for the Anthropic plugin (PR #4370)
- Updated quick start and intro CLI commands documentation (PR #4379)

categories.title: Recent Pull Requests in the elizaOS/eliza Repository

content.text:
Several pull requests have been submitted to the elizaOS/eliza repository, focusing on various improvements and features:

- PR #4370 by ai16z-demirix adds test coverage and setup for the Anthropic plugin
- PR #4369 by Vid201 fixes an issue by adding default project text to the create CLI
- PR #4384 by odilitime prepares version 0.x for sharing plugins with version 1.x
- PR #4374 by lalalune addresses an issue with short replies
- PR #4292 by jmikedupont2 updates memory.ts to use the new schema
- PR #4380 by UD1sto adds a Livepeer inference plugin package

These changes collectively enhance the functionality, compatibility, and user experience of the Eliza project.

The crypto market is showing some volatility. WETH (Wrapped Ethereum) has decreased from $1,821.64 to $1,792.55, representing a decline of approximately 1.6%. Similarly, SOL (Solana) has slightly decreased from $149.24 to $148.06, a drop of about 0.8%.

The elizaos/eliza repository showed significant activity growth over a two-day period. From April 27-28, 2025, there were 2 new PRs (none merged) with 3 active contributors. Activity substantially increased the following day (April 28-29, 2025) with 15 new PRs, 18 merged PRs, and participation from 21 active contributors.
sources: From 2025-04-27 to 2025-04-28, elizaos/eliza had 2 new PRs (0 merged), 0 new issues, and 3 active contributors.
From 2025-04-28 to 2025-04-29, elizaos/eliza had 15 new PRs (18 merged), 0 new issues, and 21 active contributors.

content.text: The provided sources mention 'Top contributors for elizaOS/eliza' but do not provide any specific details about who these contributors are or their contributions to the project. Without additional information, it's not possible to generate a detailed summary about the contributors to the elizaOS/eliza project.

GitHub issue #4336 was opened by user eduardoPauloPanstein regarding problems with the Quickstart documentation in the elizaOS/eliza repository. The issue appears to be related to documentation problems that users encounter when getting started with the system.
